member.name: F:Cavern.Listener.EnvironmentSize
member.summary: The single most important variable defining sound space in symmetric mode, the environment scaling. Originally set by the user and applied when a is created, however, overriding it in specific applications can make a huge difference. Objects inside a box this size are positioned inside the room, and defines the range of balance between left/right, front/rear, and top/bottom speakers. Does not effect directional rendering. The user's settings should be respected, thus this vector should be scaled, not completely overridden.

member.name: T:Cavern.QualityModes
member.summary: Cavern processing quality levels.

member.name: F:Cavern.QualityModes.Low
member.summary:
Lowest quality: forced maximum performance by disabling some features.
Doppler effect and pitch shifting: No. Resampling quality: Low (nearest neighbour). Channels mixed to 3D space: First. Accurate angle calculation in asymmetric mode: No. Non-approximated 3D mix for Studio/Home in asymmetric mode: No.

member.name: F:Cavern.QualityModes.Medium
member.summary:
Medium quality: maximum performance with all features enabled.
Doppler effect and pitch shifting: Low quality. Resampling quality: Low (nearest neighbour). Channels mixed to 3D space: First. Accurate angle calculation in asymmetric mode: No. Non-approximated 3D mix for Studio/Home in asymmetric mode: No.

member.name: F:Cavern.QualityModes.High
member.summary:
High quality: maximum quality except for heavy features.
Doppler effect and pitch shifting: High quality. Resampling quality: Medium (linear interpolation). Channels mixed to 3D space: All. Accurate angle calculation in asymmetric mode: Yes. Non-approximated 3D mix for Studio/Home in asymmetric mode: No.

member.name: F:Cavern.QualityModes.Perfect
member.summary:
Perfect quality: maximum quality for all features.
Doppler effect and pitch shifting: High quality. Resampling quality: High (Catmull-Rom). Channels mixed to 3D space: All. Accurate angle calculation in asymmetric mode: Yes. Non-approximated 3D mix for Studio/Home in asymmetric mode: Yes.

member.name: T:Cavern.Rolloffs
member.summary: Audio rolloff modes.

member.name: F:Cavern.Rolloffs.Logarithmic
member.summary: Logarithmic rolloff by distance.

member.name: F:Cavern.Rolloffs.Linear
member.summary: Linear rolloff in range.

member.name: F:Cavern.Rolloffs.Real
member.summary: Physically correct rolloff by distance.

member.name: F:Cavern.Rolloffs.Disabled
member.summary: No rolloff.

member.name: T:Cavern.Environments
member.summary: Environment type, which determines rendering method.

member.name: F:Cavern.Environments.Studio
member.summary:
For a single listener in the center with speakers placed around in a sphere.
Symmetric engine: balance-based.
Asymmetric engine: hybrid directional.

member.name: F:Cavern.Environments.Home
member.summary:
For a single listener or a few listeners close to each other on the center with speakers placed around in a cuboid.
Symmetric engine: balance-based.
Asymmetric engine: hybrid distance-based.

member.name: F:Cavern.Environments.Theatre
member.summary:
For many listeners. Viewers at the sides or the back of the room will also experience 3D audio, unlike in Studio or Home environments, but this will reduce the overall effect quality, even on the center.
Symmetric engine: balance-based.
Asymmetric engine: directional.
